db:abstract.db:para: The QBluetoothTransferManager class transfers data to another device using Object Push Profile (OPP).
This class was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QBluetoothTransferManager uses OBEX to send put commands to remote devices. A typical OBEX transfer is initialized as follows:
Note that this API is not currently supported on Android.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QBluetoothTransferManager::QBluetoothTransferManager(QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new QBluetoothTransferManager with parent.

db:section.db:title: void QBluetoothTransferManager::finished(QBluetoothTransferReply *reply)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the transfer for reply finishes.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothTransferReply *QBluetoothTransferManager::put(const QBluetoothTransferRequest &request, QIODevice *data)
db:section.db:para: Sends the contents of data to the remote device identified by request, and returns a new QBluetoothTransferReply that can be used to track the request's progress. data must remain valid until the finished() signal is emitted.

The returned QBluetoothTransferReply object must be immediately checked for its error() state. This is required in case this function detects an error during the initialization of the QBluetoothTransferReply. In such cases QBluetoothTransferReply::isFinished() returns true as well.
If the platform does not support the Object Push profile, this function will return 0.
